means: （尤指19世纪在后部带折叠车篷的）四轮大马车

sentence.Network_en: We got an open barouche and a wild, boisterous driver, and set out.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们雇了一辆四轮敞篷马车,和一个粗野 、 暴躁的车夫, 然后出发了.

sentence.Network_en: She got into her barouche and drove off.
sentence.Network_cn: 她又登上她的敞篷马车走了.

sentence.Network_en: An open barouche was standing there, and a woman in white had stepped out of it.
sentence.Network_cn: 一辆敞篷四轮马车停在那儿, 一个穿着一身白色衣服的女人从车上下来.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from German dialect Barutsche, from Italian baroccio, based on Latin birotus 'two-wheeled', from bi- 'having two' + rota 'wheel'

means.word_mean: 1. a horse-drawn carriage having four wheels; has an outside seat for the driver and facing inside seats for two couples and a folding top
